Avoid.origin: [modification of Old French esvuider to destroy, literally, to empty, from es - out + vuider to empty]

1.definition: to make void or undo[the trustee may any transfer of interest of the debtor in property ""]

2.definition: to respond to (an allegation or averment) by declaring that facts alleged do not result in liability [averments in a pleading to which no responsive pleading is required or permitted shall be taken as denied or"Rule 8(d)"] see alsocompare

3.definition: to prevent the occurrence of or responsibility for esp. through lawful means [ a tax] compare
